The_extension_will_try_to_always_be_list.message: The extension will try to always be listening on an active tab instead of waiting for a manual change

You_can_use_dynamic_values_to_insert_dat.message: You can use dynamic values to insert data into the bot answer:

__SUBTITLE___The_current_song_chapter_or.message: [__SUBTITLE__]: The current song chapter or song author

__LINK___The_URL_of_the_current_listenin.message: [__LINK__]: The URL of the current listening tab

__TIME___The_current_song_progression_mi.message: [__TIME__]: The current song progression (might not be always available)

__DURATION___The_current_song_duration_m.message: [__DURATION__]: The current song duration (might not be always available)

The_scanner_will_detect_if_the_music_is_.message: The scanner will detect if the music is paused based on the timestamp and trigger a pause state

Whether_or_not_the_overlay_will_display_.message: Whether or not the overlay will display the song's art

Whether_or_not_the_overlay_should_try_to.message: Whether or not the overlay should try to use the song's art colors / image as the background for the content box

how_to_install.message:
1) - Create an instance
2) - Copy the overlay link
3) - Head to OBS or streamlabs and create a browser source
4) - Paste the overlay link into the source URL
5) - Set the width to 800px and height to 400px

The default overlay should appear, this overlay will update while listening to tabs

FAQA1.message: If you encounter any issue with a tab not updating the overlay, the best way to solve it is to reload the tab (maybe multiple times). If that does not work, check that the link in the browser source is correct and as a last ressort you can re-enablee the extension.

FAQQ1.message: I am listening to a tab but the overlay is not updating, what can I do?

FAQA2.message: Due to technical reasons, it is impossible to read colours from cover arts from platforms such as Youtube and youtube music. It's also impossible to fetch covers from some platforms such as deezer or epidemic sound.

FAQQ2.message: Some platforms do not have the colored gradient but instead the cover as content background, why is that?

how_to_install_spotify_1.message:
1) - Head to Spotify for developers and login with your spotify account
2) - Head to the Dashboard and create an app
3) - Name the app (the name does not matter) and set the redirect URI to:

how_to_install_spotify_2.message:
4) - Select Web API and save the app
5) - Open the settings and copy the client ID and the client secret into the fields
6) - Click the login button to link your account

You should see the Spotify API option in the scanners list in the extension's popup

integration_explanations.message:
The extension can be configured to answer to a nightbot command, you do not need to update the nightbot command each time you make a change.

To get started, create a new custom command in your Nightbot dashboard and paste the custom command string provided below into the message field
